title: Cabbage and Kielbasa Recipe
description: Kielbasa sausage, savoy cabbage, and canned potatoes cook up quickly in this one-skillet meal that makes a nice treat for nice Octoberfest or any other night.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Cabbage and Kielbasa 4.4 (141) 106 Reviews 25 Photos This Octoberfest treat of kielbasa, cabbage, and potatoes is simple to make and so tasty! Submitted by CARAMIA Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 25 25 25 25 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ½ cup margarine 1 onion, peeled and diced 1 head savoy cabbage, shredded 1 (15 ounce) can sliced potatoes, drained 1 ½ pounds kielbasa sausage, sliced 3 tablespoons red wine vinegar salt and pepper to taste ½ cup water Directions Sauté margarine and onions in a large skillet until onions are soft. Stir cabbage and potatoes into the skillet and sauté until cabbage is wilted. Add kielbasa, vinegar, salt, and pepper; cook over low heat, stirring occasionally until cooked through. Pour water into the pan, cover, and cook another 10 minutes before serving. I Made It Print 220 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Didn't have kielbasa, so I used fresh, sweet Italian sausage and it was delicious! name: CARAMIA
instructions: Sauté margarine and onions in a large skillet until onions are soft. Stir cabbage and potatoes into the skillet and sauté until cabbage is wilted.;Add kielbasa, vinegar, salt, and pepper; cook over low heat, stirring occasionally until cooked through. Pour water into the pan, cover, and cook another 10 minutes before serving.
